isis.stitle: STEERING GENERAL SERVICE INFORMATION AND FRONT WHEEL ALIGNMENT - TIE ROD - REMOVE TIE ROD ASSEMBLY AND TIE ROD STEERING ARM

svcproc.title: REMOVE TIE ROD ASSEMBLY AND TIE ROD STEERING ARM
svcproc.para: This procedure includes removing the tie rod ends from tie rod.

step1.para: Remove the cotter pins and the nuts which secure each tie rod end to the tie rod steering arm.
Separate tie rod assembly from the tie rod steering arm, using a tie rod separator tool.
Remove the cotter pin and the nut that fastens the tie rod steering arm in the knuckle.

Remove the tie rod steering arm from the knuckle. If necessary, tap on the end of the rod with the stud nut assembled loosely on the stud (to avoid damage to the threads) using brass drift and hammer. Remove the key.
If necessary, use the following procedure to remove the tie rod ends from the rods.

step2.para: Mark the position of each tie rod end in the tie rod.
Remove the clamp bolts and nuts from the clamps on the tie rod.
Thread the tie rod ends out of the tie rod.
